name: finial
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a decorative object placed at the top of a roof on a building: The stone towers include many interesting gargoyles and finials. These Victorian roof finials are worth £1,000 each.
a decorative object at the top, end, or corner of something such as a post, fence, gate, etc.: The curtain rod is made of wrought iron with ornate finials. The church's 18th century font has a pineapple finial.
More examplesFewer examplesThe attractive, shingled roofs are topped with finials.Wrought-iron finials decorate the domed roof of the grand building.There are simple brass finials to finish the window.
